alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 11:19PM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From Tonight to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 21.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.6 feet on 03/04/1997. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued 8 AM EST Friday.
